metadata.title: 5 Things To Know: July 2, 2025
metadata.description: CNBC’s Andrew Ross Sorkin reports on the 5 things to know on July 2, 2025.

transcript.full_text: Five things to know ahead of the opening bell today. We're set to get a look at the jobs picture for June at 8:15 Eastern time. ADP is going to be releasing its latest look at private sector hiring. Now, economists are expecting an addition of 120,000 jobs for last month. We're also standing by for second quarter delivery metrics that we're going to get from Tesla. Phil Labow will be bringing us those numbers as soon as they cross the wires. As of late last month, the consensus was 393,000 vehicles, uh, deliveries that would be and uh, that would be a drop of more than 11% versus the second quarter of last year. And shares of health insurer Centene losing about a quarter of their value in the pre-market. The company pulling its 2025 earnings guidance, exciting market trends that differed from its assumptions, other health insurance companies getting hit this morning as well. And we're watching shares of Madela owner Constellation Brands. Earnings and revenue for the most recent quarter missed estimates and that's on falling demand and higher prices they're talking about for aluminum cans because of tariffs. Despite that miss, the company sticking with its full year guidance. And then there's this, Netflix has held talks with Spotify about partnering on a number of projects related to music award shows and live concert series. That's according to a report in the Wall Street Journal that said that Netflix is also considering doing some big celebrity interviews and short turnaround documentaries.

analysis.summary:
This market update provides five key insights for the opening bell. Firstly, upcoming jobs data for June from ADP is anticipated, with economists projecting an addition of 120,000 private sector jobs for the preceding month. Secondly, Tesla's second-quarter delivery metrics are highly awaited; industry consensus, as of late last month, pointed to 393,000 vehicle deliveries, which would represent an 11% decline compared to the second quarter of the previous year. Phil Labow is expected to release these figures.

Thirdly, health insurer Centene experienced a significant drop in its shares during pre-market trading, losing approximately a quarter of its value. This downturn followed the company's decision to withdraw its 2025 earnings guidance, citing market trends that diverged from its initial assumptions. Other health insurance companies also faced negative impacts this morning.

Fourthly, Constellation Brands, the owner of Madela, reported earnings and revenue for its most recent quarter that fell short of estimates. This miss was attributed to a combination of falling consumer demand and increased prices for aluminum cans, the latter being a consequence of tariffs. Despite these disappointing results, Constellation Brands confirmed it would maintain its full-year guidance. Finally, Netflix is reportedly in discussions with Spotify regarding potential partnerships on various projects, including music award shows and live concert series. This information comes from a Wall Street Journal report, which also indicated that Netflix is exploring opportunities for major celebrity interviews and quick-turnaround documentaries.

key_points.text: Five key things to know ahead of the opening bell are presented.
The jobs picture for June is set to be released at 8:15 Eastern time.
ADP will release its latest look at private sector hiring.
Economists expect an addition of 120,000 jobs for last month.
Second quarter delivery metrics are expected from Tesla.
Phil Labow will report Tesla's delivery numbers.
Consensus for Tesla's deliveries as of late last month was 393,000 vehicles.
393,000 Tesla deliveries would be a drop of more than 11% compared to the second quarter of last year.
Shares of health insurer Centene are losing about a quarter of their value in the pre-market.
Centene pulled its 2025 earnings guidance.
Centene cited market trends that differed from its assumptions for pulling guidance.
Other health insurance companies are also negatively impacted this morning.
Constellation Brands, owner of Madela, missed earnings and revenue estimates for the most recent quarter.
The miss for Constellation Brands was due to falling demand.
The miss for Constellation Brands was also due to higher prices for aluminum cans.
Higher aluminum can prices are attributed to tariffs.
Despite the miss, Constellation Brands is sticking with its full year guidance.
Netflix has held talks with Spotify about partnering on various projects.
The potential projects between Netflix and Spotify relate to music award shows.
The potential projects between Netflix and Spotify relate to live concert series.
The talks between Netflix and Spotify are according to a report in the Wall Street Journal.
Netflix is also considering doing big celebrity interviews.
Netflix is also considering short turnaround documentaries.

timeline_events.event_description: ADP to release private sector hiring data for June, anticipated to be 120,000 jobs.
Tesla's second quarter delivery metrics are expected to cross the wires, with a consensus of 393,000 vehicles.
Health insurer Centene's shares lost approximately a quarter of their value in pre-market trading.
Centene pulled its 2025 earnings guidance, citing differing market trends.
Other health insurance companies' shares were also negatively impacted this morning.
Constellation Brands missed earnings and revenue estimates for the most recent quarter due to falling demand and higher aluminum can prices.
Netflix has held talks with Spotify regarding potential partnerships on music award shows and live concert series.
Netflix is considering launching big celebrity interviews and short turnaround documentaries.

temporal_patterns.description: The announcement of ADP releasing June private sector hiring data at 8:15 Eastern time, with economists expecting 120,000 jobs added for last month.
temporal_patterns.significance: Regular economic data release affecting market outlook.
temporal_patterns.timespan: June (data), Last Month (referring to May for expectations)

temporal_patterns.description: Anticipation of Tesla's second-quarter delivery metrics being released, with a consensus forecast of 393,000 vehicles, an 11% drop from the second quarter of last year.
temporal_patterns.significance: Regular company performance update impacting stock and sector analysis.
temporal_patterns.timespan: Second Quarter (current), Second Quarter of Last Year (comparison)

temporal_patterns.description: Centene pulling its 2025 earnings guidance, causing its shares to lose a quarter of their value in the pre-market, and affecting other health insurance companies.
temporal_patterns.significance: A company action directly leading to immediate negative market impact.
temporal_patterns.timespan: Recent past (guidance pull) to Present (market reaction)

temporal_patterns.description: Constellation Brands missing earnings and revenue estimates for the most recent quarter due to falling demand and higher aluminum can prices (tariffs), despite which they maintained full-year guidance.
temporal_patterns.significance: Past financial performance leading to current market observation and future outlook confirmation.
temporal_patterns.timespan: Most Recent Quarter (miss) to Full Year (guidance)

temporal_patterns.description: Netflix holding talks with Spotify for potential partnerships on music award shows and live concert series, and Netflix considering celebrity interviews and short turnaround documentaries.
temporal_patterns.significance: Strategic discussions indicating potential future business developments and content offerings.
